revised_title: Simultaneous Disturbance of Barometer and Magnetic Needle
tldr: The author observed a simultaneous disturbance of the barometer and magnetic needle at the Zi-Ka-Wei observatory in China. The disturbance showed a large increase in the westward declination and dip, with a decrease in the horizontal component of intensity. This observation suggests a possible connection between terrestrial magnetism and meteorology, possibly linked to an aurora.
